discovery.instruction: In Windsurf, reference the worker file with @ or open it directly in the editor

documentation.getting_started: Windsurf is Codeium's AI-native IDE with agentic capabilities. It works similarly to Cursor and Claude Code - simply reference the worker file using @ or open it directly. Windsurf's Cascade feature can autonomously execute multi-step tasks from worker prompts.
tips: Use @ to reference worker files in Cascade chat
Windsurf's 'Flows' feature can automate multi-file changes
Cascade mode can autonomously work through task lists
Use Cmd/Ctrl+P to quickly navigate to worker files
Windsurf has strong git integration - follows Czarina workflow naturally
The Supercomplete feature helps with inline code generation
Can work in 'Autonomous Mode' for hands-off task execution
limitations: Some advanced features require Pro subscription

examples.title: Start autonomous task
examples.description: Let Windsurf work through worker prompt automatically
examples.command: Open worker file, select Cascade mode, say: 'Execute all tasks in this file'

examples.title: Use Flows for multi-file changes
examples.command: Cascade: 'Create a Flow to implement the changes described in @{worker_file}'
